verses.roman:
prabhura sei adabhuta caritra dekhiyā
hindu-cara kahe sei yavana-pāśa giyā

'eka sannyāsī āila jagannātha ha-ite
aneka siddha-puruṣa haya tāṅhāra sahite

synonyms: prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; sei—that; adabhuta caritra—wonderful characteristics; dekhiyā—seeing; hindu-cara—the Hindu spy; kahe—says; sei—that; yavana-pāśa giyā—going to the Mohammedan king; eka sannyāsi—one mendicant; āila—has come; jagannātha ha-ite—from Jagannātha Purī; aneka—many; siddha-puruṣa—liberated persons; haya—are; tāṅhāra sahite—with Him.
translation: The Mohammedan spy saw the wonderful characteristics of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, and when he returned to the Mohammedan governor, he told him, "A mendicant has come from Jagannātha Purī with many liberated persons.
